description.narrative: Frame support 2013 to Church of Sweden's civil society support in developing countries. Focus in partner cooperation: democracy and human rights, conflict prevention and sustainable management of natural resources.

Rambidrag 2013 till Svenska Kyrkan för stöd till det civila samhället i utvecklingsländer. Fokus i partnersamarbetet: demokrati och mänskliga rättigheter, konfliktförebyggande arbete, samt hållbar naturresursanvändning.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Övergripande fråga: Resultat kopplat till avsedd effekt 2013Fråga: Sammanfatta resultat relaterade till avsedd effekt (denna information kommer att skickas till Open Aid).Svar: During the year, Church of Sweden has primarily been active within two programmes with funding from Sida (in total working in five programs):
- "The Church of Sweden and its partners work actively in civil society for sustainable natural resource management and for people's right to sustainable livelihoods." Included in this programme are work related to disaster risk reduction, sustainable livelihoods (water, health, education, organisation and gender), natural resource management, as well as local economic and social development.
- "The Church of Sweden and partners work actively in civil society to achieve just, safe, peaceful and democratic societies, and to ensure that people are empowered to claim and defend their rights and dignity". Within this programme are conflict prevention, reconciliation, and peace building, democracy and human rights, human security as well as sexual and reproductive health and rights.
2013 was a so-called middle-year, building upon the results archived during the prior period 2010-2012 and leading up to the new programme 2014-2016. Therefore only achievements during 2013 is included in the reporting. However, the report also include the final report for the special initiative for children and young 2011-2013 as well as final reporting for the extra funds received for the years 2011-2013.
Overall, Church of Sweden is reporting results in each of the programmes and sub-programmes. Some examples are strengthened work with gender within partner organisation in Haiti, innovative methods for participation through video-documentation in Myanmar, increased disaster preparedness in some regions in India, possibility for pregnant women to live close to a hospital in Zimbabwe during the last period before giving birth, previous work resulting in 200 migration workers in line to learn more about their legal rights in Hong Kong etc. During the year, Church of Sweden has worked together with partners in almost 40 countries.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
